questions.question_text:
A company is purchasing a Microsoft 365 subscription to replace the current on-premises IT infrastructure.
You need to identify the impacts of subscribing to Microsoft 365.
Which three outcomes can the company expect? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Centralized archiving is TEAMS only.broadcast and federatedmeetings are common features for both TEAMS and S4B

OR

2 - (Local/Private)(Non-Hybrid)
"Skype for Business Server is the one you install on-premises on your own servers" 

It appears that Skype for business server can do all 3 as well:

Centralized archiving:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/plan-your-deployment/archiving/archiving

Broadcast Meetings:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/set-up-your-network-for-skype-meeting-broadcast/set-up-your-network-for-skype-meeting-broadcast

Federated meetings:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/skypeforbusiness/manage/federation-and-external-access/managing-federation-and-external-access

I am inclined to think that Microsoft wants us to know that Both Teams, and Skype for business server, can meet this need, either OnPrem, or Off Prem.

Ans:
Teams and Skype for business server, for all 3
Correct
Teams and Skype for business server in all

According to the resource:

1. Centralized archiving is Teams only
2. Broadcast meetings: Teams only (as SfB can only do this in a hybrid environment)
3. Federated meetings: Both

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company plans to deploy collaboration tools for employees. The company does not plan to deploy a hybrid environment.
You need to identify the features that are available in Teams and Skype for Business Server.
Match each environment to its feature. To answer, drag the appropriate environments from the column on the left to the features on the right. Each environment may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

Your organization plans to deploy a subscription-based licensing model of Microsoft Office to devices.
You must use group policy to enforce Office application settings.
You need to deploy Office to the enterprise.
Which version of Office should you deploy?

discussion.content:
- Answers B and D are wrong because they are not a subscription-based licensing model
- Answer C is not the name of an existing product (not a licensing plan)
==>> Answer A "Office 365 Pro Plus (now called "Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise") is the correct answer
A "Office 365 Pro Plus (now called "Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise")

A should be now "Microsoft 365 Apps" or full "Microsoft 365 Apps for Enterprise"
But A is correct.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/overview-licensing-activation-microsoft-365-apps

A is the answer
Correct Answer

questions.question_text:
An organization plans to deploy Microsoft Office 2019 or Office 365 ProPlus.
What are two advantages of Office 365 ProPlus? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.A: Features remain constant through the lifetime of the applications.
choices.D: Fully functional Office mobile apps are free to install and use.
choices.C: A single license may be deployed to multiple devices.

questions.answer_description:
✑ A single subscription of Office 365 ProPlus allows you to install Office 365 on up to 5 devices.
✑ Office 365 ProPlus includes a fully functional, cloud-based online version that is free to use, though it does not require any installation.
Incorrect Answers:
Office 365 subscriptions (E3, E5, etc.) do not allow for downgrading.
Office 365 ProPlus is updates automatically. Updates include updates to existing features as well as new features being added to the product.
Reference:
https://xo.xello.com.au/blog/office-365-proplus-top-business-benefits-for-users https://support.office.com/en-us/article/what-s-new-in-office-online-fc1de049-98f3-46da-a5aa-da4a19c3e909?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US

discussion.content: Correct
Correct Answer
